hostNotes.text:
Welcome. I am X and today we will work for around 30 minutes on acceptance and letting go of control.\
\
We’ll be doing a short meditation together, then we’ll take a moment to reflect on our own, and the final step is to share with each other.

Let’s start with a mini check-in. How are you feeling right now? Please answer in two-three words. X, would you like to start?

> Let everyone in the session, including yourself, check in one by one.

Thank you all for checking in. Let’s get started.

When difficult feelings arise, many of us have a natural tendency to try to control them. The **impulse to control things can make us feel in charge**. But science shows that this is just an **illusion.**

Find a comfortable position, relax your shoulders. Let's do this meditation together. 

> Push play to start the meditation.

Now we’ll take a minute to reflect on our own.

What's in your own beach ball? What is it that you are pushing below the surface?

You can take notes on a piece of paper or just mental notes in your head. And there is no right or wrong here, our answers are our own. 1 minute starting now.

> Push play to start the timer.

Okay, that’s 1 minute. Let’s move on.

Now we are getting into the sharing part. We have three rules for sharing:

1. **What is said in here, stays in here.**
2. **All you need to do is listen.** There is no fixing, helping or advice-giving needed. We are just showing up and exploring what ourselves and others are going through.

3. **Everything on the inside is okay.** Anger, love, hatred, sadness. Whatever shows up. No wrongs, no rights. It is what it is.

There will be a timer set for 2 minutes as an indicator. If you don’t want to share you can always say ‘pass’.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone (or as many as you got time for) share one by one. Push play to start the timer. Re-start for each new sharing.

Thank you so much everyone.

The more time and effort we spend trying to control our feelings, the more they tend to dictate our lives. The same goes for a lot of things in life. Sometimes we believe that the **more** **control** we have, the **closer** we will get to reaching our **goals**.

That can be true in some instances...

But when we get stuck in a loop of trying to control ourselves and the events around us, we often end up **diverging** **from our values.** Or miss out on participating in important occasions that actually matter to us.

Now we’ll take a minute to reflect on our own again.

What if you let go of your beachball? What would that mean to you? What would you do differently?

1 minute starting now.

> Push play to start the timer.

Okay, that’s 1 minute. Let’s move on.

content.heading: What if you let go of your beachball?
What if you let go of your beachball?

hostNotes.text:
Time for a next round of sharing.

What if you let go of your beachball?

There will be a timer set for 2 minutes as an indicator. If you don’t want to share you can always say ‘pass’.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone (or as many as you got time for) share one by one. Push play to start the timer. Re-start for each new sharing.

Thank you so much everyone.

Letting go of control may seem **scary**, risky and very **uncomfortable**. By practicing **acceptance,** we can learn how to **make room** for a range of feelings and experiences, without trying to escape, numb or fight the ones we don’t want or like. This allows us to redirect our focus and instead spend our energy on all things that are important to us.

Well done. if you’re up for it, you can continue what we started here today with a mission to bring this into your everyday life.

For the rest of today and tomorrow, see if you can notice when you have difficult feelings and are trying to push them away. Then re-focus and see if welcoming them, or just letting them be there with you, can help you act differently. Do more of what’s important to you and bring your feelings along.

Before we leave this space let’s do a mini check-out. 

How are you feeling right now? Has anything shifted? Please answer in two-three words.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone in the session check out one by one.

Thank you all for checking out and for joining this session today.

> Finish session to send everyone off to the exit experience.

en.name: Letting go of control

hostNotes.text: `Start the session when you're ready to go.`

en.description: Trying to control what we feel or think tends to backfire. In this exercise we practice letting go of a futile struggle, and instead use our energy for what matters.
